page.title: 10Farming - Pigs
page.content: The pig farm is well away from the village for obvious reasons. Mr.Bell rears the pigs in special buildings called units.He breads the pigs himself and has about 85 piglets each week.He feeds them a compound feed which is mainly barley and fish meal.He raises them acording to weight for bacon and pork.He sends out each Friday to the abattior. He employs another person but he has to work very hard himself,usually about twelve a day.He feeds all the stock before breakfast and then does general work and maintenance. He does,infact,have some cattle and sheep sa well as making hay and silage.Farming can be a tricky busin- ess and it is better to have different market outlets rather than relying on pigs alone.
